CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1962, pg. A12, reads: "THE FIRST BITE - Ivan Carter accepts the first bite of wedding cake from his bride, the former Valeria Johnson, at the reception which followed their recent nuptials. - Harris Photo." Portions of accompanying article read: "Miss Johnson is the Bride of Ivan Carter - One of the season's prettiest weddings took place recently at Carrone Baptist Church, when Miss Valeria Johnson became the bride of Ivan Carter.  The Rev. Dr. Porter W. Phillips officiated at the rites.  THe bride is the daughter of Mrs. Dorothy Johnson of New York City, while the groom's parents are Mr. and Mrs. William Carter.  Mrs. Georgia Norris was organist and Gaddiel Goode, soloist.  The wedding was directed by Mrs. Lucy Coleman.  The bride who chose satin as the fabric for her own gown, selected the same material for the gowns of the attendants, and those of her mother and the mother of the groom.  Given in marriage by her uncle, Richard Smith, the bride was radiant in a gown of wite satin and lace.  Her fingertip veil of illusion was held in place by a tiny pill box of draped satin and seed pearls, designed by Miss Theresa Johnson, sister of the bride, who also served as maid of honor.  The bridesmaids included Miss Marva Carter in rose, and Robin Carter, pink.  James Carey served as best man and Melvin Jackson was an usher...a reception was held at the American Legion Post 913..."
TitMainTitle: Bride Valeria Johnson Carter wearing pill box hat and satin gown, feeding wedding cake to groom Ivan Carter, possibly in American Legion Post 913
